Activity: Arrive, make tea (Rooibos today!). Review overnight tickets and emails.
Follow up with EHR vendor and third-party application vendor regarding the API incompatibility issue from yesterday.
Address a new ticket reporting issues with data synchronization between the EHR and a remote patient monitoring system. Troubleshoot the issue by first checking the data synchronization logs.

Discover that the data synchronization issue is related to a network connectivity problem between the EHR server and the remote patient monitoring system. Escalate the issue to the network team for investigation. Email @itpm-1 about network connectivity issue, and ask for update. @PEOPLE
While waiting for the network team to resolve the connectivity issue, begin working on another ticket reporting issues with generating reports containing protected health information (PHI).

Investigate the report generation process and the PHI handling mechanisms. Ensure that the reports are generated in compliance with HIPAA regulations. Email @his-2 and @clinlead-1 for suggestions on ensuring HIPAA Compliance for report generation. @PEOPLE
Implement the necessary security measures to protect PHI in the generated reports. Review all the report related issues, and prepare a summary and improvement proposal.
Document the security measures and the report generation process.
Lunch Break. Listen to a podcast about mindfulness and meditation.

Receive confirmation from the network team that the connectivity issue has been resolved. Follow up with the user to ensure that data synchronization is now working correctly. Update the ticketing system and close the ticket.
Monitor the ticketing system and address new incoming tickets.
Review the knowledge base article and make any necessary updates based on the week's troubleshooting experiences.
Prepare a summary report of the week's help desk activities, including the number of tickets resolved, the types of issues encountered, and the solutions implemented. Share it with IT team lead.
Plan for the next week's activities, including any outstanding issues or projects that need to be addressed. Brainstorm on improvement of working efficiency and collect more data.
Check emails one last time. Prepare for the weekend!
Leave for the day. Time for a relaxing weekend!
